title: Fraud-accused psychiatrist can be named
text:
Fraud-accused psychiatrist can be named 
Monday 3 Aug 2015 12:51 p.m. 
The man accused of pretending to be a qualified psychiatrist at Waikato Hospital can now be named. 
Mohamed Shakeel Siddiqui appeared in Hamilton District Court via video link today, when he lost his name suppression. 
The 55-year-old is accused of fraud over a six-month-long ruse in Waikato Hospital. 
He was charged with fraud in July after hospital doctors became suspicious about his competence and a background check suggested he had got the job using someone else's qualifications. 
Siddiqui, who wants to apply for bail, entered no plea to one charge of obtaining by deception more than $1000 by fraud. 
He was remanded in custody until August 31. 
NZN
